dublinCore.dc:title: 114 S403 RS: North Country National Scenic Trail Route Adjustment Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Klobuchar (for herself, Mr. Leahy, Mr. Franken, Mr. Sanders, Ms. Stabenow, Mrs. Gillibrand, Ms. Baldwin, Mr. Peters, Mr. Brown, and Mr. Hoeven) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
Reported by Ms. Murkowski, with an amendment
action.action-instruction: Insert the part printed in italic

form.official-title: To revise the authorized route of the North Country National Scenic Trail in northeastern Minnesota and to extend the trail into Vermont to connect with the Appalachian National Scenic Trail, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the North Country National Scenic Trail Route Adjustment Act.
Section 5(a)(8) of the National Trails System Act (16 U.S.C. 1244(a)(8)) is amended in the first sentence—

paragraph.text: by striking thirty two hundred miles, extending from eastern New York State and inserting 4,600 miles, extending from the Appalachian Trail in Vermont; and
by striking Proposed North Country Trail and all that follows through June 1975. and inserting North Country National Scenic Trail, Authorized Route dated February 2014, and numbered 649/116870..

section.text: Section 5(a)(8) of the National Trails System Act (16 U.S.C. 1244(a)(8)) is amended by adding at the end the following: No land or interest in land outside of the exterior boundary of any Federally administered area may be acquired by the Federal Government for the trail by condemnation..
